content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Can you provide me with the data on:
1) How many resident parking permits have been issued to residents of Harcourt Road on each of the following years:
August 2022-2023
2) How many times 3 or more resident permits have been issued to one household
3) How many times 4 or more residents permits have been issued to one household.
4) All of the above questions but for the time period of September 2023 only.
Yours faithfully,
James Little.

Dear James Little,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Harcourt Road
Parking Permits which we received on 25/09/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 23/10/2023. Please do not hesitate to contact
us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is
intended solely for the individual(s) to whom it is addressed. It may
contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council
will not accept any liability for damage caused by computer viruses
emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail

Dear James Little,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Harcourt Road
Parking Permits which we received on 25/09/2023.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Before we can begin to process your FOI Request, we would like to clarify
what information you require.
Could you please clarify if you would like information until August 2023.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to a
request within 20 working days. The 20 working day clock will start the
day after we receive the necessary clarification.
You can provide your clarification by replying to this email. Please
note, if clarification is not received within 2 months your Freedom of
Information request will be closed.
We look forward to hearing from you.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
This Email, and any attachments, may contain non-public information and is

contain sensitive or protectively marked material and should be handled
accordingly. If this Email has been misdirected, please notify the author
immediately. If you are not the intended recipient you must not disclose,
distribute, copy, print or rely on any of the information contained in it
or attached, and all copies must be deleted immediately. Whilst we take
reasonable steps to try to identify any software viruses, any attachments
to this Email may nevertheless contain viruses which our anti-virus
software has failed to identify. You should therefore carry out your own
anti-virus checks before opening any documents. Sheffield City Council

emanating from any attachment or other document supplied with this e-mail

Dear FOI,
Thanks. This should be inclusive of August 2023.
Yours sincerely,
James Little

Dear James Little,
Thank you for your clarification relating to Harcourt Road Parking Permits
which we received on 06/10/2023.
We will now continue to deal with this under the Freedom of Information
Act.  The reference number for your request can be found above.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days. The 20 working day clock will start the day after
we receive the necessary clarification. Therefore, you should expect to
receive a response from us by 03/11/2023, but we kindly ask for your
patience as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please
do not hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any
queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [1][Sheffield City Council request email]
show quoted sections

Dear James Little,
Thank you for your clarification relating to Harcourt Road Parking Permits
which we received on 06/10/2023.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
1) How many resident parking permits have been issued to residents of
Harcourt Road on each of the following years:
August 2022-2023 (185)        Sept 2023 (27 permits issued)
2) How many times 3 or more resident permits have been issued to one
household Aug22 – Aug 23 (14 households)   Sept 2023 0 households
3) How many times 4 or more residents’ permits have been issued to one
household. Aug 22- Aug 23 (9 households) Sept 2023 0 households
4) All of the above questions but for the time period of September 2023
only.
Please see above answers.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see
[2]
https://ico.org.uk/make-a-complaint/offi...
for further details.
Kind Regards,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [3][Sheffield City Council request email]
From: FOI
Sent: Monday, October 9, 2023 5:37 PM
To: James Little <[FOI #1030931 email]>
Subject: Re – Freedom of Information Request – Reference – FOI / 929116

patience as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please

Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
